p: To determine the number of geographically cohesive genetic groups of R. flavipes, we analyzed geo‐referenced mtDNA sequences in BAPS v.6.0 (Cheng, Connor, Siren, Aanensen, & Corander, 2013). We assessed values of K (i.e., the number of clusters) ranging from 2–20, with 10 replicate runs each. We also examined evidence for geographically cohesive genetic groups by representing the variance in mtDNA sequences using Principal Components Analysis (PCA), performed with the “prcomp” function in R.
